name: Khalil Center
mission: Khalil Center provides the following clinical services: 1.
theoryOfChange: Khalil Center utilizes a 'Traditional Islamically Integrated Psychotherapy (TIIP)' therapeutic framework, which serves as their model of care. This framework integrates professional psychology into an Islamic framework, drawing from a 1400-year-old tradition. Their approach emphasizes psychological reconstruction, behavioral reformation, and spiritual elevation. The TIIP model considers the complex construct of a human being, focusing on 'aql (cognition), nafs (behavioral inclinations), rūḥ (spirit), and iḥsās (emotions). It integrates classical spiritual practices like Murāqabah (Islamic Contemplation), Duʿā (Supplications), and Dhikr into clinical practice. The 2023 Annual Report states that the TIIP model has been proven and is officially recognized as an evidence-based modality for the Muslim population.

evaluationSources: Practice-based evidence study published in Spirituality in Clinical Practice
Research published in Journal of Muslim Mental Health

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 39/50, the charity shows high donor fit by addressing urgent humanitarian needs through a faith-based psychological framework [2]. It maintains a clear track record of community education and clinical service delivery tailored to the Muslim community [4][5].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a program expense ratio of 71.2%, directing the majority of its $2,272,898 in total revenue toward clinical appointments and professional training [1][3][4]. While it successfully delivers psychotherapy sessions, the impact score of 31/50 reflects a relatively high cost per beneficiary of approximately $907.87 [5].

impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Tracking session volume and training reach ensures that clinical resources are effectively reaching the intended beneficiaries.

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="1">$0.01 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions, significantly outperforming industry benchmarks for lean operations.

The center has successfully scaled its operations to deliver <cite id="5">70,136 psychotherapy sessions</cite> and manage over <cite id="4">13,065 scheduled clinical appointments</cite> in a single year.

The foundation maintains a <cite id="2">dedicated zakat policy</cite> that directs funds to <cite id="2">eligible poor and needy (fuqara and masakin)</cite> individuals seeking mental health services.

strengths_deep_dive: The Khalil Center's impact is rooted in its ability to bridge the gap between professional clinical standards and spiritual needs. Their <cite id="5">School of Islamic Psychology & Research</cite> provides a formal framework for this integration, while their direct services are backed by a <cite id="3">100% independent board</cite> ensuring objective governance. Financially, the organization maintains <cite id="3">total assets of $1,019,702</cite>, supporting a stable platform for its <cite id="1">geographic coverage across the USA, Canada, and Pakistan</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Khalil Foundation, operating as the Khalil Center, is a specialized mental health organization that integrates <cite id="5">psychological sciences with Islamic theology</cite> to serve the Muslim community. Since its <cite id="1">founding in 2010</cite>, the organization has expanded its reach across <cite id="1">multiple states including California, New York, and Illinois</cite>, as well as international locations. The charity reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $2,272,898</cite> in 2023, primarily driven by <cite id="3">$1,476,207 in program service revenue</cite>, reflecting a model that combines charitable contributions with fee-for-service clinical care. The center maintains a <cite id="3">program expense ratio of 71.2%</cite>, ensuring that the majority of funds directly support its core missions of <cite id="5">psychotherapy, community education, and professional training</cite>. Notably, the organization demonstrates exceptional fiscal discipline in its development efforts, maintaining a <cite id="1">fundraising efficiency of $0.01 per $1 raised</cite>. Beyond direct clinical care, the Khalil Center acts as a capacity builder for the broader community, having <cite id="5">delivered 324 didactic trainings</cite> and providing <cite id="5">70,136 total psychotherapy sessions</cite> as of its most recent reporting. This dual focus on individual healing and systemic education positions the foundation as a critical infrastructure piece for Muslim mental health in the West.
